content.description: There used to be a campground host at Millard who was definitely on crack, but not this kind of crack. The route starts on a slab with a kind of high first bolt. Clip the bolt to your left and then follow the crack up while clipping more bolts out to the left. Finish by traversing left to the 3 bolt anchor.
content.protection:
4 New 3/8 bolts with 1 rusty 1/4 at the top left as a history lesson. Please don't use cams on this route it protects fine with the bolts and the rock might not hold a fall on gear.

It is possible to set up a TR for this route but it is pretty sketchy. There's a trail above the canyon and right above this route there is a boulder with a bolt and a metal post. Clip the bolt and sling the post and rap down the steep yucca filled dirt hill. Clip into the anchors and pull your rope. Do not do this unless you have the canyon to yourself because you will knock down a ton of rocks.
content.location: On the right side of the waterfall to the far right. Start at a slab in the corner.

climbs.name: I wanna be a drug sniffing dog

content.description: The route name comes from a song from the band Lard. This route is on the left side of the right canyon wall. Start up an easy ramp climbing above the small pool and head straight up to a small roof. Pull the bolt protected crux moves and head up and right to the anchor.
content.protection:
5 bolts to a 3 bolt anchor shared with the crack route.

You can TR this route from rapping down from the trail above the falls, but it is sketchy and you will knock down loose rocks. If you want to TR this just lead the crack route and then clip some of the bolts on this route as directionals.
content.location: To the right of the waterfall. This route is on the left side of the right canyon wall. To the left of the crack route.

content.description:
From JMC on Supertopo Oct. 07 -"New (relative) bolted line I put up last August, still hasn't gone fully free. 6 or 7 bolts painted grey, straightforward aiding (I think you need to stickclip the first one, or make some hook move to get to it.) The bottom bulge is the crux, I think 5.12ish. The rest of it (from bolt 2) is 5.11, with some good hand jams in the diagonal crack, 2nd crux exiting the crack. Some good climbing, but I could have done a better job on the bolting."

I tried to aid this and got shut down hard. I had to stick clip the first bolt. Then there's a big gap between the 3rd and 4th bolt I could not get past free or aid without a stick clip. The route goes up and right and then cuts back left to merge with the left bolt ladder a few bolts before the anchors.

C2 if aiding or 5.12 if climbing
content.protection: 10 bolts, maybe a few cams, hooks for aiding and a stick clip.
content.location: Center bolt line on the left side of the waterfall.
